message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys database from 2016, we analyze the relationship between women-owned businesses and access to finance in Latin America and the Caribbean.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys database"], "topic": ["Gender", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use the Global Consumption Database to examine patterns of meat consumption around the world and their implications for climate change mitigation efforts.", "dataset": ["Global Consumption Database"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines data from the Fragile States Index and the International Debt Statistics database to explore the impact of debt on fragility and conflict in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Fragile States Index", "International Debt Statistics database"], "topic": ["Debt", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of satellite data from NASA and meteorological data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), we investigate the relationship between air pollution and extreme weather events.", "dataset": ["NASA satellite data", "National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) meteorological data"], "topic": ["Environment", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the International Energy Agency (IEA) and the US Energy Information Administration (EIA) to estimate the impact of renewable energy policies on jobs and economic growth in developing countries.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "US Energy Information Administration (EIA)"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We combine household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) with geospatial data on water availability to measure the impact of water scarcity on public health outcomes in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "geospatial data on water availability"], "topic": ["Water", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use firm-level data from the World Bank's Doing Business database and a complementary dataset of internet search volumes to investigate the relationship between business regulations and corruption in Asia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business database", "complementary dataset of internet search volumes"], "topic": ["Governance", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on panel data from the World Values Survey and the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) to explore the relationship between family planning policies and women's empowerment in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a novel dataset that combines satellite imagery from ESA's Sentinel-2 program with administrative data on crop yields to estimate the impact of climate change on food security in India.", "dataset": ["ESA's Sentinel-2 program", "administrative data on crop yields"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Human Development Index and the World Inequality Database, we investigate the relationship between education and income inequality across different regions of the world.", "dataset": ["Human Development Index", "World Inequality Database"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Education"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "Using the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys database from 2016, we analyze the relationship between women-owned businesses and access to finance in Latin America and the Caribbean.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys database"], "topic": ["Gender", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use the Global Consumption Database to examine patterns of meat consumption around the world and their implications for climate change mitigation efforts.", "dataset": ["Global Consumption Database"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines data from the Fragile States Index and the International Debt Statistics database to explore the impact of debt on fragility and conflict in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Fragile States Index", "International Debt Statistics database"], "topic": ["Debt", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of satellite data from NASA and meteorological data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), we investigate the relationship between air pollution and extreme weather events.", "dataset": ["NASA satellite data", "National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) meteorological data"], "topic": ["Environment", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the International Energy Agency (IEA) and the US Energy Information Administration (EIA) to estimate the impact of renewable energy policies on jobs and economic growth in developing countries.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "US Energy Information Administration (EIA)"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We combine household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) with geospatial data on water availability to measure the impact of water scarcity on public health outcomes in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "geospatial data on water availability"], "topic": ["Water", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use firm-level data from the World Bank's Doing Business database and a complementary dataset of internet search volumes to investigate the relationship between business regulations and corruption in Asia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business database", "complementary dataset of internet search volumes"], "topic": ["Governance", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on panel data from the World Values Survey and the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) to explore the relationship between family planning policies and women's empowerment in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a novel dataset that combines satellite imagery from ESA's Sentinel-2 program with administrative data on crop yields to estimate the impact of climate change on food security in India.", "dataset": ["ESA's Sentinel-2 program", "administrative data on crop yields"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Human Development Index and the World Inequality Database, we investigate the relationship between education and income inequality across different regions of the world.", "dataset": ["Human Development Index", "World Inequality Database"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Education"]}]
